channel.title: Anthony Matsas
channel.description: I am a computer science student in Chicago, attending Lewis University.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description:
Hello everyone! This is my official first post, I have decided to give blogging a go. Their have been attempts in the past by myself (obviously) to try and get into the whole blogging scence, but I would always just get too busy or lose motivation.

I have been using GitHub pages to host my personal website for about a year now and have always been aware of jekyll existing, but never really got into tinkering with it. After sometime I randomely got an urge to check it out and see what it is all about. Anytime I got bored in class for the last couple of weeks I decided to install jekyll on my laptop and see what it can do. I wrote some practice blogs just to see if the hype about it was real. And after seeing this…

class Hangman_Reader:
    def read_file(self,file_name): # Read words into a list from the provided text file
        file_var = open(file_name, "r")
        word = ""
        word_list = []
        for line in file_var:
            word = line.strip()
            word_list.append(word)
        return word_list

I just wanted to post snippets of code for the hell of it. All that and more simply lead to my decision to replace my prior personal site, with this one you see now!

Anyways, the goal now is to actively post anything I find interesting. Posts will most likely range from awesome code snippets to anything Chicago Bulls, so pretty much anything I feel at that particular momment.

Finally, as my first post comes to an end I want to thank anyone and everyone ahead of time that somehow stumbles upon this! Thanks for stopping by :)

–Also, on a side note, for anyone interested in jekyll check out the Jekyll docs for more information!
